text: <!channel> Question for you bikers: if there were some sort of sensor out there that alerts you if an object behind you is getting closer really fast, would you use it?
I'd be curious about it. but worried about calibration/angles
I haven’t had any issues that would make me want to purchase something like that
I can normally hear something approaching anyway
I mean, is something coming at me from any direction or directly behind?
yeah i’m usually a lot more worried about something coming at me from the side
Sorry, I meant not just straight behind but maybe from 8 to 4 o'clock.
wouldnt that just get triggered any time a car passes me?
You can calculate speeds and trajectories so it would only alert you if it were going to hit you.
there'd have to be a fine line on what triggers it. As long as the sensor can keep track of objects for more than one "frame", thereby determining the objects' trajectory
i mean, all this math has been done before by the navy, so it doesn't seem that out-of-this-world
Agreed.
Maybe I need to be a better biker instead of trying to build something to prevent accidents :wink:
hah! and other drivers could be better too. I think any kind of "autohorn" will always be a stopgap measure
Ha, I ride on the path 95% of the time some my “almost-accidents” are with bikers.
by a sensor showing what is behind you do you mean like a mirror

If only I had one of these to tell me what's up if someone comes up hot behind me.

<http://cdn.newadnetwork.com/sites/prod/files/uploads/garneaujessica/dora.jpg>
hey i have one of those! kinda
I can’t use a mirror and like riding alone.
Is that homework with eyes sticking out her backpack pocket?
No Gaston, that's a map to tell Dora where she needs to go.
You have a child, how do you not know this? I even know this
All I know is her face b/c it’s on 33.3333% of her diapers.
So her name is Dora. Interesting...
